title: I Wish, I'd Rather, I'd Better

questions.question: I would rather you ........................... at me.
questions.description: After would rather, we use a past tense with a present meaning.

questions.question: I wish I ........................ work on Saturdays.
questions.description: After I wish, we use a past tense with present meaning.

questions.question: You'd better ....................... me my money back.
questions.description: After had better, we use the infinitive without to (first form of the verb).

questions.question: After the way he behaved at my party, I wish I ......................... him.
I'd rather ........................... up early on Sundays.
The program starts at 6 o'clock. You had better ..................... late.
I'd rather you ........................... on Tuesday than Monday.
questions.description: After would rather, we use a past tense with present meaning.

questions.question: I wish I ............................. to work tomorrow.
questions.description: After I wish, we use a past tense with present meaning.

questions.question: I wish you …………………. insist on leaving early.
You'd better ........................... him with your crude jokes.
questions.description: After had better, we use an infinitive without to. Negative forms are made by putting not before the infinitive.

questions.question: I wish I ........................... get a scholarship.
questions.description: A past tense is used with present meaning after would rather.
